intro: Lomatocarpa alata, commonly known as the winged lomatocarpa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive, winged bracts that give it its common name and help in seed dispersal. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves with a hairy texture, adapted to arid environments. Lomatocarpa alata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
